ygData.subject: Re: Media type derivation: standardize the + semantics?
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree in the case of Sebastiens proposal. All iÂ´m proposing, is to standardize something, that is already a (in some cases an unwritten) convention. I think

I agree in the case of Sebastiens proposal. All i=B4m proposing, is to stan=
dardize something, that is already a (in some cases an unwritten) conventio=
n.

I think it would improve extensibility and visibility on the web: I can=
 introduce new media types based on existing ones. Any client, e.g. a brows=
er, being aware of the "hierachical media type" concept could render a "app=
lication/contact+xhtml+xml" as usual (if he has no clue what contact+html i=
s) or could do something useful with it. For example, providing the user a =
popup with "Do you want to add this contact to your address book?".

Conneg=
 and user agent header would also enable backward compatibility by sending =
"just application/xhtml+xml".

Am i missing something? I feel, that would h=
ave a great impact on web interaction...

n co-exist

r couldn't

ention because

 it the way it

cussed in the

cally, if I am

g is a snippet

t media type to expect

he same as not adhering to any other media type,

ippet would not even be a valid representation of

e.

lication/atom+xml" representation is still a valid "application/xml"

esentation. As far as i know, this is anyway state of the art. it is

compatibilty is also given for intermediaries: if they do

tion concept, the visibility increases. if they do not know

on, they would handle such a media type as an unknown media

 intermediary today, who knows xml but not atom, would ignore

nts.
